channel.title: Brown on Sam's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Brown on Sam's Blog

item.title: Brown_2
item.description: Long are the days of township solitude. But solitude held little connotation to the norm definition. Solitude meant that nobody around you knew who you were. People of all creeds still interacted with you because the density of the city forced people to be open and socially capable of the many endeavors it took to know a stranger. With high respect and courtesy you would reciprocate the same social wellbeing onto the them.

item.title: Brown_1
item.description: Dealing with pain. God damn I was never any good at it. Pain was the enemy for the longest. I despised its presence and reaped nothing from it when it was present. They say that there are two kinds of pain, one that makes you stronger, and one that it useless. My mind has been scattered to the fucking wind. I woke up at 8:30pm today. This will be a long night; I have faced longer nights in the past though.
